title: Events of the Week: ‘Curb Your Enthusiasm,’ Grammys Parties and More
description: Here’s a look at this week’s biggest premieres, parties and openings in Los Angeles and New York, including events for Curb Your Enthusiasm, Mr. & Mrs. Smith and the Grammys. Curb Your Enthusiasm premiere Larry David,

title: Parties united in tackling unfinished business of finance for NI – Donaldson
description: Northern Ireland political leaders met at Stormont Castle on Friday ahead of the return of devolved government on Saturday.

title: Reform support in Red Wall hits highest level ever
description: Richard Tice’s party now on 14 per cent across 40 of the traditionally Labour-held seats won by the Tories in 2019, poll shows

title: Sunak vows to tackle intimidation faced by ‘too many’ MPs
description: Rishi Sunak has vowed to “deal with” the intimidation that many MPs face after Mike Freer, the Tory MP, announced that he was stepping down following death threats.

title: Liverpool City Council to repay millions after jobs target missed
description: A council is to give millions of pounds back to the government after a jobs target for a waterfront regeneration project was not met. Liverpool City Council has blamed a car park fire for the inability to create hundreds of jobs on Kings Dock.

title: Eleven candidates announced for Rochdale by-election
description: Eleven candidates have been announced in a by-election which was called after the death of a veteran Labour MP. The poll in Rochdale was triggered after Sir Tony Lloyd died in January, days after announcing he had an incurable form of leukaemia.

title: Labour's quaint tradition of scrapping their £28bn green pledge
description: For those mercifully shielded from the tedium of Labour Party policy, a short recap. The policy was first announced by Rachel Reeves in 2021, who boasted of her ambition of being the “first green chancellor”. READ MORE: 'What's the point?':

title: Pub relaunch party tonight - and you'll recognise who's behind the bar
description: A Kidsgrove pub is celebrating a change of ownership with a relaunch party. Licensee Ian Cooper has reopened The Clough Hall. The 50-year-old already ran the Clough Hall Road venue for nearly three years.

title: Junior Transport Minister 'fully supports' raising Dublin Airport cap as coalition divided

title: Labour will look for 'radicalism' through reform rather than risk fiscal slip-up

title: Marjorie Taylor Greene mocked for struggling to pronounce indictable or read a long number
description: Ms Greene’s gaffe occurred on Tuesday while the House Homeland Security Committee debated whether or not the homeland security secretary Alejandro Mayorkas should be impeached

title: Safeguarding the union deal: DUP leader Sir Jeffrey Donaldson says parties united in tackling unfinished finance for Northern Ireland
description: The new Stormont powersharing executive will be united in dealing with the “unfinished business” of funding for public services in Northern Ireland, DUP leader Sir Jeffrey Donaldson has said.

title: Labour deputy leader doubles down on workers' rights pledges after backtracking reports
description: Angela Rayner reiterated a commitment to introduce draft legislation within 100 days of a Labour victory to enshrine its employment promises in law. It comes following claims the party had rowed back on some of its pledges.

title: Labour is in the worst of all worlds with confused messaging on its £28bn pledge
description: Tories watch on delighted as Starmer continues to talk about the figure while the shadow Treasury team distances itself from it

title: ‘Dishing out licences to climate criminals’
description: CAMPAIGNERS attacked the government for “dishing out licences to climate criminals” today after a Tory donor-owned firm, previously fined for illegal flaring, secured a licence to drill for fossil fuels. The government green lit new licences to 17 oil and gas companies in the North Sea in the last week.

title: A message to Starmer from the US: ditching your £28bn climate plan isn’t just cowardly – it’s bad politics

title: Business bosses fear ‘sting in the tail’ on taxes from Labour, says insider
description: In front of bosses from companies including Microsoft and Aviva, shadow Chancellor Rachel Reeves pledged that Labour would freeze corporation tax for five years if it wins the next election.

title: Power sharing in Northern Ireland set to be resurrected two years after collapse
description: In a historic moment Sinn Fein's Michelle O'Neill will become the first republican First Minister after the DUP ended a two-year political paralysis at Stormont

title: Green Party candidate to meet Southam residents
description: THERE is a chance to meet the Green Party candidate for Kenilworth and Southam. Coun Zoe Leventhal is inviting residents for tea and cakes at the Grange Hall in Southam tomorrow (Saturday). The event runs from 12.

title: Shish, that's expensive: Spiralling cost of doner kebabs is debated in German parliament as producers warn price of national dish will soon pass ten euros
description: Germany 's well-publicised 'winter of discontent' has just taken yet another turn for the wurst as the price of a doner kebab continues to climb - with some warning it could soon reach ten euros

description: The new Stormont powersharing executive will be united in dealing with the “unfinished business” of funding for public services in Northern Ireland, DUP leader Sir Jeffrey Donaldson has said.

description: Darren Jones says party will decide budget based on state of economy and individual projects if it wins election

description: Labour deputy leader says green spending would depend on state of public finances during visit to Scotland

title: Rachel Reeves: The Labour MP’s whopping five-figure salary revealed
description: However, there has been a major update today during the course of another Sky News interview: a senior MP has confirmed Labour is dropping the £28bn target for green investment. Darren Jones, the shadow chief secretary to the Treasury, revealed this morning that the party has already ditched the plan.

title: Labour’s core supporters have been betrayed. And it will haunt Keir Starmer
description: You can see why Labour has decided to keep things as they are in this regard. The party is desperately keen to be seen as supportive of business and financial services, and they do not want to shake up or alienate those sectors in an election year, at an extremely difficult economic juncture.

title: Politics latest news: Labour starts pre-election talks with civil service
description: Reform UK has hit its highest ever level of support in crucial Red Wall seats, according to a new poll. A Redfield & Wilton Strategies survey, conducted between Jan 30-31, put Richard Tice’s party on 14 per cent of the vote. That was up by three points when compared to the company’s previous poll conducted between Dec 17-18.

title: Angela Rayner: Labour not committed to ‘arbitrary’ figures on green investment
description: Drew Hendry, the SNP’s economy spokesman, said: "This latest U-turn by Sir Keir Starmer, which mirrors the economic negligence of the Tories, is a deeply damaging move that threatens jobs, investment and economic growth in Scotland – at a time when it's needed more than ever.”

title: Green Party Welcomes Decision To Save Promote Learning Disability Service

title: Labour not committed to ‘arbitrary’ numbers on green investment – Rayner
description: Labour deputy leader Angela Rayner has said the party is not committed to “arbitrary” numbers on its pledge to ultimately invest £28 billion a year in the green economy. She said the money will depend on sticking to fiscal rules and Labour will “ramp up” to this figure if in government.

title: Ryanair's Michael O'Leary calls Environment Minister Eamon Ryan 'useless' over Dublin Airport row

title: Donaldson ‘will hold Government’s feet to the fire’ over Stormont deal
description: The leader of the DUP has warned the Government he will hold its “feet to the fire” on delivering on the deal to restore Stormont as he admitted he did not fully trust it. Sir Jeffrey Donaldson said independent monitoring mechanisms built into the agreement meant there were means to ensure the Government was doing what it has pledged to do.

title: Alliance Calls For Swifter Implementation On Gynaecological Services
